description: who wants an app that leaves their watermark until you pay.... there are other programs work just as good with no hostage software installed
The Watermark is printed all over the scanned page and says you have to buy the program to remove the watermark... Use another program instead!
summary: Leaves annoying Watermark all over the page

description:
Pros: Supports a bunch of scanners. Offers some hard to find features/options like film & slide scanning and bulk scanning.
Cons: Costs $80 USD for a lifetime license. Closed source. The version here is old.
Flatpak version here is not able to contact my Epson USB connected scanner, so I install (non-sandboxed) version from the vendors site.
If you don't pay for the full verion, you're left with a watermark on all your scans. NOT something that should be available in Linux.

I have been using ViewScan since before I switched to Linux. I bought it when my two obsolete scanners stopped working and I couldn't find drivers for Windows 8.1. ViewScan rescued them from the trash. Move on a few years and I have mostly left Win 10 and OSX behind for Manjaro Linux. Guess what: downloaded the Linux build of ViewScan, plugged in my key and ViewScan just works. The licence is a one-off which, spread over the number of years and scanners I have had, is negligible. I know it's not open source but...
summary: Rescued my scanners from the bin

description: Can't get it to install on newest Ubuntu Budgie.
watermarks sucks

There are better alternatives that are open source and don't
 have a watermark. Do we need to have this in the Store?
summary: "leaves a watermark" I don't think so!

description: Watermarked, non-OCR in the "free" version. No driver issues though.
summary: I liked the options but it's not FLOSS

description: I was just rtying to make a pic from a scan, from my disabled roommate drew; and then I was immediately upselled.

VueScan is a little bit expensive, but it supports out of the box a lot of scanners. No need for messing around with scanner-drivers and sane. Therefore i think it is worth every penny. It also offers a lot of Options while Scanning.
The free Version of VueScan is pretty useless because of the Watermark. I think the only purpose of the free version is to test if your scanner is working correctly.
I would suggest "Skanlite". Fits the bill.

I bought this app originally in 2012, ran a Mac. Over the years I've bought new scanners, bought new computers, now running Linux and I am still able to use the latest version of the software from my original purchase. Can't beat it. Like any pro software there is a learning curve - once you wrap your brain around VueScan you'll love it.
summary: Like a lot of pro software there is a learning curve

description: Cost money to work properly.

Yes you have to pay for this but you get lifetime support, continuous upgrades and bug fixes. i have used this to scan film negatives, photos, documents etc. Will save in many formats (.tif, jpg, pdf, raw) can correct for skew, do inverse. You can set profiles for different film types. You can set it to a basic, standard or professional interface (where you can tweek everything). One license is cross platform - Linux, Mac, Windows. Download the latest .deb from their website. The application prompts you to auto update. I have used this for many years and it has never and it just works great.
summary: Works with any scanner (Canon, Epson, HP, Brother etc.)

description: If the free open source 'sane' project does what you need then certainly use that first, but there are many scanners whose features are not fully supported by 'sane'. If that's the blocker for you then VueScan fills this gap very well if you're willing to pay the one-time fee for the license. I've used it on Linux for going on 15 years and it does an excellent job, especially with film/slide scanning and IR cleaning.
summary: Supports all features of more or less any scanner ever made

description:
Yes, there is a cost - but worth it due to extremely easy license on multiple computers, operating systems and recovery of your license key in case of reinstallations. Documentation is very good - but don't expect any personal handholding. Some apps are a touch simpler, but the value of the professional edition and the information from Hamrick is worth every penny. 
Upgrading could be a bit smoother on linux - but the short README file tells you the basics as to where the handful of files go. 
Better indication of the current version on the downloaded file would be nice - but updates are extremely frequent - there were more than two dozen updates last year. So, the software stays Very current if you use the download hint. Just make sure you remember/keep the original e-mail you used to register in case you need to move to another computer.
summary: Has More Device Drivers than any other Scan Software

description: You need to learn how to use it, and the result will be great. To scan negative & positive, even with an affordable scanner & you'll get very good images. It must be tweak.

If you want to use a properly useful set of features you have to buy a license: although this is not too expensive.

It's a reliable and functional piece of software, so no complaints from me.

I could find nothing that came close for my scanner (Brother DCP-7055) available in the AUR or elsewhere that worked as well (or at all in many cases).

Worth paying £30 for a license.
summary: It costs money (full version), but it's not expensive for what it does

description: Clunky and leaves a huge watermark on every image, don't use!

This software couldn't locate my standard HP all in one printer scanner... 
also seems to be a limited software unless you buy a license...
In contrast, the simple open source document scanner did the trick, no muss, no fuss
summary: couldn't identify a scanner that is 1 foot away on wifi..

description:
On Fedora 35 Workstation (Gnome) - This app doesn't work on Epson 4490 because after installing iscan-gt-x750-bundle-2.30.4.x64.rpm (the driver package for a range of Epson scanners) - the program still pop up an error message "VueScan found Epson Perfection 4490, but no plugin for this scanner was found on your system".

Workaround (at least this works for me): Install the Vuescan software by downloading from Vuescan home page.
summary: Flatpak doesn't work with certain Epson scanners (workaround exists)

description: Don't waste your time. This is a premium app with little more functionality than Windows Fax & Scan, except it also keeps trying to sell you services by opening up the web browser.
summary: NOT free software, repeatedly up webpages

description: veraltete properitäre software die bei jedem zweiten klick den kauf einer lizenz bewirbt und ohne jene lizenz auf jede seite ein rießiges wasserzeichen drüberlegt... unbrauchbar ohne lizenz, den zweiten stern gibts weil sofort alles ging...
Leider ist keine aktuelle Version hier verfügbar.
Sehr zufrieden. Auch Canon Lide 220 klar erkannt.
Same (pro) version as on the homepage.
Kompliziert, aber gut
nach dem installieren braucht Lizenz :|
Es pago y si se usa gratis pone una marca de agua en las imágenes, que tampoco he podido ver porque no me reconoce bien las carpetas del sistema o algo así, porque no me guarda las imágenes
summary: Es pago y pone marca de agua

description:
Aunque sea de pago la licencia es de por vida. Y además da igual las veces que la instales. 
Para impresoras brother funciona de maravilla y es el perfecto sustituto del software Control Center de Brother.
Elimina páginas en blanco, cuadra las hojas que han entrado torcidas con "sesgar automático", etc...
No me guarda los archivos escaneados
add watermark on scans, app asking for money all the time
fonctionne avec tous mes ancien scanner et bien sur n'importe lequel actuel.
Cette application est remarquable et fait très bien son travail. Mais elle est payante et met un filigrane si on n'achète pas la licence... Du temps perdu...
Payant mais accessible par rapport au prix du scan, don c la solution pour mon epson V850 Pro. Logiciel performant et très fonctionnel qui remplace xsane que ne détecte pas ce scanner.
summary: Payant mais accessible et la solution pour mon epson V850 Pro

description: Ne devrait pas se trouver dans le magasin d'applications Ubuntu !
Отличное приложение, поддерживает принтер 7420 brother и даже пакетное сканирование через АПД
